reviewText: Road Madness is an indie arcade" racing title that was created in Unity... personal edition. *cough* *cough*.\n\nThe above sentence should've been enough to deter you from bothering to purchase this title
date: but if it wasn't I will elaborate further. The game has no controller support
recommended: you must control your car with the A + D keys
hoursPlayed: and you can use left and right click to fire missiles and bullets respectively. As far as I can tell
voteText: there is no way to manage the speed of your vehicle. Essentially
helpfulPercent: you will be weaving left and right on a very narrow path
votesHelpful: while avoiding obstacles that will wreck your car and collecting coins to purchase upgrades and more cars.\n\nYou will be subjected to hearing the same god forsaken 30-45 seconds of music for the duration of the intro
votesFunny: and first level. Luckily the other levels will allow you to listen to a different short loop of music
commentsCount: but prepare to be driven mad for the first ten minutes you spend on this game. Road Madness also attempts to have a story
column16: but fails miserably at doing so since it only includes a small intro at the start of the game. Basically
column17: you're racing for your death for the entertainment of others.\n\nWhat isn't entertaining at all
column18: is the entirety of this game. The physics are just awful to the point where when you hit a ramp
column19: you will be flung into the air and you will slowly descend back to the ground... usually just in front of an obstacle that you couldn't shoot out of the way because you were 100 miles north of land. This game
column21: does not have any controller support
column22: nor does it have any settings whatsoever. It's pure lazy development. Oh
column23: and I guess I should point out that the missile/bullet gauges have a stolen
column24: slightly modified logo from The Offspring. *golf clap*\n\nThe bottom line? Road Madness isn't worth your time
column25: even for a buck. Just avoid it altogether
column26: you're not missing anything but a cruddy experience with poor graphics that are barely on par for a PSX era game. I also feel that the trailer on the store page is misleading
column27: as far as I could tell there is no way to get your camera angle to go to the side; it's all a straight on
column28: behind the car shot. Upon reading the "positive" reviews for this game
column29: I feel like the developer had a bunch of his friends come in and give one-liners about how "great of a time waster" this game is. I'd rather waste my time on a good title
column30: and so should you. Better luck next time

This game is bad. Controls are pretty horrible, can't turn off music without turning off all sounds, turning off the music requires you to start a game to get to that option, and missiles have no visual indication that they've fired. Even further on the missile issue is that they will only hit the next eligible target from what I can tell.

Save your dollar or donate it to charity, either option is better than buying this game.

reviewText:
This game is terrible.  There is no nice way to say it.
The only interaction you really have is moving left and right, and having 2 weapons to fire.  Sounds like it could still be alright?  WRONG!
Once you get above a certain 'speed' (and I put that in quotations because there is no way to tell how fast you are going, or control it) the minigun becomes usesless as the bullets fire behind you.  The rockets also ONLY work if they are targetted to something, which (from what I could tell) only seemed to be money and a few doors.

So once you get used to this piece of ♥♥♥♥, you hit level 3.  Now level 3 is the definition of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.  There are these giant rolling snowballs, which move side to side on the course, and you have to dodge them.  Unfortunately they move side to side 4 times (twice in each direction) per second, and the first one is right at the start before you have any speed.
So I went and bought the fastest car I could afford (the blatant Lamborghini rip off), and it turns out which this car, I had about a 10% chance of making it past the first one!  Hooray!   And so I began getting past the first one, and I quickly learnt that I had about a 40% chance of making it past the second one, a 70% chance of making it past the third one, and a 95% chance of making it past the rest,  which doesn't sound too bad, but it really is.

Anyways, so I'm smashing it through with the fast car, and I'm starting to get closer to the end of the level, and you come across these little road blocks, where all 3 'lanes' are blocked, 2 by a concrete block, and 1 by barrels.  Now I've played racing games before, and it's obvious that you should hit the barrels... WRONG!  Each barrel you hit (and they are in a stack of about 7-9) takes 1 damage off you, whereas hitting the contrete block takes 1 damage off you.  Long story short, I instantly wrecked.  Back to the start I go... Oh, and it's worth mentioning that about 5% of the time your car doesn't start moving at the start, so you have to exit out and go back in.

So I keep trying, and keep practicing, and I finally make it to the end of the level, and I hit the last 'jump' ANNDDDD... I go *through* the jump.  Off into the abyss, and I don't complete the level.  So I painstakingly do it all again, and go *through* the final jump again.  So it looks like I now need to use one of the slower cars.  The cars where I can NEVER seem to get past the original snowball... (as in - I think I've only made it past it once in roughly 30 minutes - and it takes about 4 seconds to get to it)...

Even for an achievement hunter, I would not wish the pain of this game on ANYONE.  It's exactly why developers should be FORCED to upload a Demo on Greenlight before they can even be voted on.

Save your money for another game, or a skin on CSGO.  Hell owning a FAMAS Doomkitty would be better than getting cancer from this game.

PS.  I was also wondering HOW this game could possibly get ANY positive reviews.. until I actually looked at the positive reviews.  They have varying play time (2-5 hours) and have not unlocked a single achievement (very unlikely since it takes about 1 minute to get the first one).  They all also seem to currently be playing identical games, and reviewing identical games :).  It seems the developer has actually paid for positive reviews....

UPDATE: After over 90 minutes I beat level 3.  It's worth noting that you still can't use the Lamorghini on the next level, as it falls through the ground.  Well, it turns out ALL cars do, but the slower ones get launched UP so you land back on the track..

I beg you, don't support the developer by buying this.

reviewText: I beat the game within 15 minutes, using only the starter vehicle. There's supposed to be a story, but it doesn't hold at all. The physics are terrible (I went through bridges on one level, and through a ramp on one of the frist two levels), and most of the you can't even fire your machine guns, so to avoid certain obstacles, you either need to be very quick or just have luck on your side. If it's the creators' first game, it's not /too/ terribly bad, but I wouldn't recommend it unless you have a dollar to throw away.
